value.title: UK Plans To Use Smartwatches & Facial Recognition To Surveil Convicted Migrants
value.excerpt: Migrants convicted of a crime in the U.K. may soon have to submit five daily facial recognition scans via a smartwatch as part of sweeping new surveillance practices under consideration by the country’s Home Office and Ministry of Justice.

value.title: UK may use facial recognition smartwatches to monitor migrant criminals
value.excerpt: The UK government may soon start using facial recognition smartwatches to monitor migrants who have been convicted of crimes. The offenders would need to scan their faces up to five times per day, according to The Guardian.

value.title: Southern Co-Op faces legal complaint over facial recognition CCTV
